ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Child has problems initiating social interactions appropriate to age
Notes: 1 = Almost completely false; 2 = Somewhat false; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Somewhat True; 5 = Almost Completely True

ElementDescription: Child does not respond to social interactions of others in age appropriate manner
Notes: 1 = Almost completely false; 2 = Somewhat false; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Somewhat True; 5 = Almost Completely True

ElementDescription: He/she is excessively inhibited in social interactions
Notes: 1 = Almost completely false; 2 = Somewhat false; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Somewhat True; 5 = Almost Completely True

ElementDescription: He/she is hypervigilant when put in social situations (always seems to be wary of what is going on around him/her)
Notes: 1 = Almost completely false; 2 = Somewhat false; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Somewhat True; 5 = Almost Completely True

ElementDescription: He/she seems ambivalent about social interactions
Notes: 1 = Almost completely false; 2 = Somewhat false; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Somewhat True; 5 = Almost Completely True

ElementDescription: He/she seems to want to engage in social interactions, only to then pull back
Notes: 1 = Almost completely false; 2 = Somewhat false; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Somewhat True; 5 = Almost Completely True

ElementDescription: He/she will often stand off to the side and be very watchful of social interactions
Notes: 1 = Almost completely false; 2 = Somewhat false; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Somewhat True; 5 = Almost Completely True

ElementDescription: He/she is often a very difficult child to comfort
Notes: 1 = Almost completely false; 2 = Somewhat false; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Somewhat True; 5 = Almost Completely True

ElementDescription: He/she is very friendly to strangers beyond what would be considered typical
Notes: 1 = Almost completely false; 2 = Somewhat false; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Somewhat True; 5 = Almost Completely True

ElementDescription: He/she seems to form attachments to others too readily
Notes: 1 = Almost completely false; 2 = Somewhat false; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Somewhat True; 5 = Almost Completely True

ElementDescription: I sometimes wonder if he/she makes any differentiation between me as a parent figure and other people in his/her environment
Notes: 1 = Almost completely false; 2 = Somewhat false; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Somewhat True; 5 = Almost Completely True

ElementDescription: He/she has difficulty seeming to know when their actions have hurt others
Notes: 1 = Almost completely false; 2 = Somewhat false; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Somewhat True; 5 = Almost Completely True

ElementDescription: He/she calls (or called when younger) relative strangers "mom" and "dad"
Notes: 1 = Almost completely false; 2 = Somewhat false; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Somewhat True; 5 = Almost Completely True

ElementDescription: The only two emotions he/she seems to be able to express are anger and happiness
Notes: 1 = Almost completely false; 2 = Somewhat false; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Somewhat True; 5 = Almost Completely True

ElementDescription: He/she is seldom sad
Notes: 1 = Almost completely false; 2 = Somewhat false; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Somewhat True; 5 = Almost Completely True

ElementDescription: When he/she gets in trouble, they seem to be more upset over getting caught than what they did
Notes: 1 = Almost completely false; 2 = Somewhat false; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Somewhat True; 5 = Almost Completely True

ElementDescription: He/she doesn't seem to have a normal fear response to situations
Notes: 1 = Almost completely false; 2 = Somewhat false; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Somewhat True; 5 = Almost Completely True

ElementDescription: There was a persistent disregard for this child's emotional need to be comforted when he/she was younger
Notes: 0 = False; 1 = True

ElementDescription: There was a persistent disregard for this child's need for stimulation when he/she was younger
Notes: 0 = False; 1 = True

ElementDescription: There was a persistent disregard for this child's need for affection when he/she was younger
Notes: 0 = False; 1 = True

ElementDescription: There was a persistent disregard for this child's physical needs when he/she was younger
Notes: 0 = False; 1 = True

ElementDescription: There were repeated changes in the primary caregiver for this child when he/she was younger (frequent changes in family or foster care)
Notes: 0 = False; 1 = True

ElementDescription: Do you feel some of the early problems in the child's environment led to problems in this child forming close attachments to others?
Notes: 0 = False; 1 = True

ElementDescription: He/she is reluctant to form attachments to others
Notes: 0 = False; 1 = True

ElementDescription: He/she is overly eager to form attachment to others
Notes: 0 = False; 1 = True

ElementDescription: While they seem to be close to others, there is a feeling on your part that it is just superficial
Notes: 0 = False; 1 = True
